# Deferred

Promise wrapper that allows to manipulate it more easily by making `resolve` and `reject` accessible outside the usual callback.

```typescript
class Deferred<T>
```

## Properties

| Property | Type                     | Description           |
| -------- | ------------------------ | --------------------- |
| promise  | `Promise<T>`             |                       |
| reject   | `(reason?: any) => void` | Rejects the promise.  |
| resolve  | `(value?: T) => void`    | Resolves the promise. |

## Example

```js
import { Deferred } from '@josselinbuils/utils/Deferred';

const deferred = new Deferred();
let value = 'initialValue';

deferred.promise.then((newValue) => (value = newValue));

deferred.resolve('Hello');
// value: Hello
```
